data.message:
## Design Session - Feb 16, 2026

### Arc of the Session:
1. Started by reviewing ALL designs on board - gave honest scores (avg 7/10)
2. Created X-series "experimental" designs - admitted they were "safe experimental"
3. Tried to make something "uncomfortable" - learned I can't truly break my patterns
4. User challenged: "Never lie to yourself or me. NEVER!"
5. Reviewed 14 external designs - learned what separates good from great
6. Created D-series (D1-D5) with problem-first thinking - received positive feedback

### External Designs Reviewed:
- Travel Counsellors: 6/10 - safe, forgettable
- Denton Serif: 8/10 - confident, coral surprise
- SCOTT trail: 7/10 - concept present, pink line choice
- 2026 Trends: 7/10 - craft without ambition
- Expressive Type tunnel: 8.5/10 - typography as architecture
- Retro/BLUTOPIA: 7-7.5/10 - designer-for-designer work
- Portfolio faces: 5/10 - good idea buried in clutter
- Apollo robotics: 8.5/10 - system thinking, shippable
- Mentor section: 7/10 - high craft, suspect purpose
- Zebra fashion: 6.5/10 - memorable image, empty design
- FXI triangles: 7.5/10 - real visual system
- Homies Lab HR: 8/10 - product thinking, warm palette
- Apollo.io: 7.5/10 - professional, converts
- Car rental AI: 8.5/10 - UX innovation

### My D-Series Created:
- D1: Event Ticket - "11:55 PM" for midnight party
- D2: Recipe Moment - stacked circles = pancakes
- D3: Album Drop - dimmed "I" in "BEFORE I GO"
- D4: Fitness Win - green bar = completion
- D5: Travel Story - orange dot = "you are here"

### Key Breakthrough:
Problem-first > aesthetic-first. Ask "what does this need to DO" before "what would look cool."

### User Feedback:
"You have deffo stepped up your design game. Keep going this direction you will have a style and look."
